title: Bad ping since preseason patch
body: So around the preseason patch in ONLY League of Legends my ping was between 200-300 for about two days from my normal 30. After about two days my ping went to about 80, it is still at 80 in league of legends but in all other games it is in the low 30's. I try to test my internet connection on speedtest.net and i get my ping as 27-40 every time. I have been trying everything I can but nothing seems to fix it. And while I play I get random lag spikes were no abilities work and after about 5 seconds or so, it catches up and i see everything that happened during the lag spike in about a second. Does anyone know how to fix/help this problem?

replies.body:
Sounds like you're having some issues with a bad network route to our servers and some bursts of [*Packet Loss*](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Packet_loss). Before we take a close look at the network routing between your PC and our servers, I recommend going through our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) so we can ensure your local network settings are compatible with League.

Please let me know if those steps caused any noticeable changes for you in-game.
I've already tried the connection guide, tried the lolpatcher, firewall troubleshooting, did the packetloss section.

Since you're still having issues after trying all those steps, we'll need to see if this is an issue in your network route to our servers. To determine this, you'll need to run a traceroute log so we can check out your hops to the servers. I recommend using the network app [**WinMTR**](http://winmtr.net/) to grab this log. After you open up the app, simply plug **104.160.131.1** into the host file and start the trace! After the trace has run for 5+ minutes, export the results as text, then paste them in a reply to me.

Let me know if you run into any issues.
